body_content.explanation: to remove a formal or official title or description from a person, an organization, etc., usually so that they no longer have the right to do something:
examples: They filed a petition with the National Labour Relations Board as the first step towards trying to decertify the union.
The board decertified the farming operation as organic.

body_content.explanation: to say that someone is no longer qualified (= officially agreed to have the necessary skills) to do a particular job, taking away their legal right to do it:
examples: If an air traffic controller is decertified they must go through retraining and be recertified.
